lower_inv_triangular:
theorem LDL.lower_inv_triangular {i j : n} (hij : i < j) : LDL.lower_inv hS i j = 0 := by
  rw [‚Üê
    @gram_schmidt_triangular ùïú (n ‚Üí ùïú) _ (_ : _) (inner_product_space.of_matrix hS.transpose) n _ _ _ i j hij
      (Pi.basisFun ùïú n),
    Pi.basisFun_repr, LDL.lower_inv]
#align LDL.lower_inv_triangular LDL.lower_inv_triangular
lower_inv_orthogonal:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `¬´expr‚ü™ , ‚ü´‚Çë¬ª -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `matrix.transpose -/
theorem LDL.lower_inv_orthogonal {i j : n} (h‚ÇÄ : i ‚â† j) :
    ¬´expr‚ü™ , ‚ü´‚Çë¬ª (LDL.lower_inv hS i) ((matrix.transpose S).mul_vec (LDL.lower_inv hS j)) = 0 :=
  @gram_schmidt_orthogonal ùïú _ _ (_ : _) (inner_product_space.of_matrix hS.transpose) _ _ _ _ _ _ _ h‚ÇÄ
#align LDL.lower_inv_orthogonal LDL.lower_inv_orthogonal
lower_inv_eq_gram_schmidt_basis:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `matrix.transpose -/
/-

theorem LDL.lower_inv_eq_gram_schmidt_basis :
    LDL.lower_inv hS =
      matrix.transpose
        ((Pi.basisFun ùïú n).to_matrix
          (@gram_schmidt_basis ùïú (n ‚Üí ùïú) _ (_ : _) (inner_product_space.of_matrix hS.transpose) n _ _ _
            (Pi.basisFun ùïú n))) :=
  by
  ext (i j)
  rw [LDL.lower_inv, Basis.coePiBasisFun.toMatrix_eq_transpose, coe_gram_schmidt_basis]
  rfl
#align LDL.lower_inv_eq_gram_schmidt_basis LDL.lower_inv_eq_gram_schmidt_basis
lower_conj_diag:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `matrix.mul -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `matrix.mul -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `matrix.conj_transpose -/
/-- **LDL decomposition**: any positive definite matrix `S` can be
decomposed as `S = LDL·¥¥` where `L` is a lower-triangular matrix and `D` is a diagonal matrix.  -/
theorem LDL.lower_conj_diag :
    matrix.mul (matrix.mul (LDL.lower hS) (LDL.diag hS)) (matrix.conj_transpose (LDL.lower hS)) = S :=
  by
  rw [LDL.lower, conj_transpose_nonsing_inv, Matrix.mul_assoc,
    Matrix.inv_mul_eq_iff_eq_mul_of_invertible (LDL.lower_inv hS), Matrix.mul_inv_eq_iff_eq_mul_of_invertible]
  exact LDL.diag_eq_lower_inv_conj hS
#align LDL.lower_conj_diag LDL.lower_conj_diag
diag_eq_lower_inv_conj:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `matrix.mul -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `matrix.mul -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `matrix.conj_transpose -/
/-- Inverse statement of **LDL decomposition**: we can conjugate a positive definite matrix
by some lower triangular matrix and get a diagonal matrix. -/
theorem LDL.diag_eq_lower_inv_conj :
    LDL.diag hS = matrix.mul (matrix.mul (LDL.lower_inv hS) S) (matrix.conj_transpose (LDL.lower_inv hS)) :=
  by
  ext (i j)
  by_cases hij : i = j
  ¬∑
    simpa only [hij, LDL.diag, diagonal_apply_eq, LDL.diag_entries, Matrix.mul_assoc,
      euclidean_space.inner_pi_Lp_equiv_symm, star_star]
  ¬∑ simp only [LDL.diag, hij, diagonal_apply_ne, ne.def, not_false_iff, mul_mul_apply]
    rw [conj_transpose, transpose_map, transpose_transpose, dot_product_mul_vec,
      (LDL.lower_inv_orthogonal hS fun h : j = i => hij h.symm).symm, ‚Üê inner_conj_symm, mul_vec_transpose,
      euclidean_space.inner_pi_Lp_equiv_symm, ‚Üê IsROrC.star_def, ‚Üê star_dot_product_star, dot_product_comm, star_star]
    rfl
#align LDL.diag_eq_lower_inv_conj LDL.diag_eq_lower_inv_conj
